recommendations: Amy Cell ‚ÄúI met Chandra when I was teaching a course on Project Management & Consulting at the University of Michigan. He was a pleasure to have in class and a great addition to the learning experience of his classmates. He made thoughtful observations during class discussions, and was always looking to learn and grow. During the consulting project, he used his tremendous creative skills to come up with innovative solutions to the problem One of the most amazing things about him is his continuous urge to adapt himself according to the circumstances to deliver the best results - which can be challenging during projects with a high level of ambiguity. It is commendable that with his rigorous class schedule & extracurricular activities he got the top grade in my course that testifies his potential, commitment to the task in hand, teamwork and presentation skills He will be an asset to the organization he joins.‚Äù

Ashesh Srivastava ‚ÄúI have known Chandra for more than 8 years now in personal and professions capacity. He is focussed on a task and aims to get results. His perseverance, focus, and never give up attitude is un parallel. You can always find him with innovative, constructive and noble ideas on problems around us. He also takes interest in others problems and helps them out in anyway he can. The best part of him is that whatever he chooses to do, he does it extensively and deeply in that area.‚Äù
